learning_outcomes.description: Critically reflect on primary health, evidenced based woman centred collaborative practice from both national and international perspectives.

Cross examine the midwife-woman relationship from a social, cultural, emotional, spiritual, professional, and legal perspective including how the boundaries of the midwifery partnership are defined and negotiated.
Critically review the regulatory bodies that oversee the registration of midwives and safeguard childbirth nationally and internationally.
Cross examine woman centred care with alternative care paradigms in relation to the effects on health outcomes for mothers and babies.
Rationalise how evidence-based woman centred reflective practice in midwifery can improve outcomes for mothers and babies and reduce inequalities.

22/08/2025 1:00 pm

Once you start the exam you will have 60 mins to complete and submit via Blackboard Ultra.
assessments.task_description: This assessment is designed to assess your understanding of the key concepts covered in the first 4 weeks of the course .Please refer to the task sheet and marking rubric for this assessment available in the course Blackboard site.
assessments.submission_guidelines: This will be an off campus, online non-invigilated assessment on the platform Blackboard Ultra.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Exams submitted after the end of the submission time will incur a late penalty.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Critical Essay Woman Centred Care in Midwifery Practice
assessments.task_description:
Critical Essay Woman Centred Care in Midwifery Practice

Word limit: 2000 words. A word count that is within +/- 10% of this word limit is acceptable. A word count outside these 10% will result in 10% reduction of the total mark available. Reference lists and appendices are not included in the word count.

Font: Calibri 11, Times New Roman 12, Arial 10

Line Spacing: Double

Reference system: APA 7th 

Header: Student ID (eight digits), Course Code

Footer: Total word count, page number.

Please refer to the task sheet and marking rubric for this assessment available in the course Blackboard site.
assessments.submission_guidelines: All courses require students to submit an electronic version of their assignment via Blackboard. Submit via the course link turn it in. Please refer to ITS help if you experience difficulties in submitting your assessment in Blackboard or using Turnitin.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
19/09/2025 - 24/10/2025

You are required to submit one video journal Friday 1300 in weeks 8,10, & 12 three video journals in total
assessments.task_description:
Storytelling in Midwifery [3 Video Journals]

This assessment requires you to reflect on a maternal clinical care episode in the context of the provision of woman-centred care. For this assessment you can choose a past or present clinical care experience, or a continuity of care experience. This is an ongoing assessment that requires you to create three (3) engaging five (5) minute video entries. Time length for each of the presentations must be within +/- 10% of the allocated time. A time limit outside this 10% will result in 10% reduction of the total mark available. 

Please refer to the task sheet and marking rubric for this assessment available in the course Blackboard site. 

Video Journal-This assessment for this course will be recorded in alignment with UQ policies and procedures. A presentation time that is within ±10% of the set time is acceptable. For presentation time that is outside this (by 10%) will be penalised through a reduction of 10% of the total mark available for the assessment.
assessments.submission_guidelines: All courses require students to submit an electronic version of their assignment via Blackboard assessment link.  Please refer to ITS help if you experience difficulties in submitting your assessment in Blackboard or using Turnitin.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

Course introduction lecture

This face to face lecture will introduce and discuss in detail, course requirements including the exam, critical essay and video journals assessment. Attendance is highly recommended.

learning_activities.topic:
Module 1 The philosophy of midwifery

Students will complete Module 1online learning activities.
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 1 The philosophy of midwifery Students will complete Module 1online learning activities.

learning_activities.topic:
Woman Centred Care in Practice Tutorials

Midwives use storytelling as a way of sharing and developing practice. Using stories relays information in a powerful way that enhances learning. Knowledge and skills are fundamental to midwifery practice but knowing how to use them is the illusive “art” of practice. The use of storytelling personalises and humanises the experience and engages the listener, and this allows for reflection and an authentic learning experience that helps to develop your art of midwifery practice. This course tutorial students will come together and share stories of developing woman-centred care practice. Students should attend these tutorials via the Zoom link supplied in the course Blackboard.
